ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Simple Critireas
ygData.msgSnippet: I always recommend starting with the default rules, then making individual changes that are each understood. You ve left off the PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Simple Critireas
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=3F7qWpgnR7KoD_mEwkmpZNWPqIIUShMf_CRgl-4ylcUA
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I always recommend starting with the default rules, then making 
individual changes that are each understood.

You've left off the PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule and the 
TransclusionDecideRule. At least one of these is required for the DNS 
fetches, prerequisites for getting anything else from a named host, to 
be allowed. Add at least the Prerequisite rule to the end of your rules.

By not having the TransclusionDecideRule, you might miss iframes and 
redirects to other-host URIs that (as far as users arc concerned) seem 
to be "on" your target host. Perhaps this is OK for your purposes, but 
it's something to be aware of.

Leaving off the PathologicalPath and TooManyPathSegments rules means a 
few kinds of URI patterns that are usually indicative of crawler traps 
(endless URI spaces of negligible value) won't be eliminated. This might 
not be an issue for your crawl, but it's another thing to consider.

- Gordon @ IA

disappearedng@... wrote:
> Hey everyone,
> I am experimenting with Heritrix to try out some simple search algorithms that I have designed. Unfortunately, my bandwidth sucks hence I will only crawl my neighbourhood's inner LAN domains.
> 
> These are the critirieas that I want:
> 1) exclude these rubbish for now: REGEX: .*(?i)\.(doc|xls|pdf|gif|jpe?g|mpe?g|tiff?|ps|png|swf|wmv|mp3|wma|ico|bmp|rm|rmvb|avi|zip|rar)$
> 2) Ignore [\S]*lwakaka.com[\S]*
> 3) ignore [\S]*59.77.131.[\S]*
> 4) Only crawl from those domains of the seeds
> 
> I have tried the whole day experimenting with a deciding rule filter, and I have set the following (which makes the most logical sense but still fails):
> 
> Base org.archive.crawler.deciderules.AcceptDecideRule ?
> AcceptRule: always gives ACCEPT decision.
> 
> Crap  org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule ?
> Decision: Reject
> regexp: .*(?i)\.(doc|xls|pdf|gif|jpe?g|mpe?g|tiff?|ps|png|swf|wmv|mp3|wma|ico|bmp|rm|rmvb|avi|zip|rar)$
> 
> lib   org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule ?
> Decision: Reject
> [\S]*lwakaka.com[\S]*
> 
> lib2   org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule ?
> Decision: Reject
> [\S]*59.77.131.[\S]*
> 
> LAN org.archive.crawler.deciderules.NotOnHostsDecideRule ?
> DECISION REJECT
> 
> When I submit this job,
> I am getting the following error:
> Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress1.ca
>  Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress2.ca
>  Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress3.ca
>  Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress4.ca
>  Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress5.ca
>  Heritrix(-63)-Prerequisite unschedulable failure 
> Failed to crawl seed 	http://lanaddress6.ca
> 
> can someone explain WHY? I am using org.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingScope by the way...
> 
> 
> What settings should I use to suit my needs??
> 
> Regards
